label: 書始
本: A Tale of Flowering Fortunes:  Annals of Japanese Aristocratic Life in the Heian Period (Volumes One and Two) . Stanford University Press . 1980
説明文: Fumihajime, performed when the son of a high-ranking family had reached the age of seven or eight.  Ostensibly intended to show the child how to read, it was a purely symbolic event, during which the elaborately robed young principal sat in silence while a Reader (Jidoku) intoned, and a Repeater (Shōfuku) repeated, a few words from a suitable text, usually the Classic of Filial Piety (Hsiao-ching) (p. 429).
